channel.title: Priest converted form change
channel.description:
The thing I like about the unseen is each converted form is very similar to it's previous class, with a few exceptions, one of those exceptions being priest.
Here is a way to keep the priest similar when converted:
>**The Monk** unseen support **Passive ability: Luck of the faithful** Immune to death once **Passive: Whispers of the grave** You can speak and listen to the dead at night as "priest" **Day ability: Bind soul** (1 use) your target will be immune to death tonight. **Night ability: Reanimate** (1 use) select an unseen player (possibly yourself), a class from a pop-up menu, and a dead player. If the target unseen member dies, they will appear to be the class you selected, and the dead player you selected will be revived. If they are a convert able class, they will become their unseen version.
Note: I do not know if this is balanced or not. I think it is?

item.title: Priest converted form change
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
soul catcher is fine, I just don’t like that it came from priest.

I think this class would be more interesting

Read full topic

item.title: Priest converted form change
item.dc:creator: Moleland
item.description:
I don’t think there’s anything wrong with soul catcher

Read full topic

item.title: Priest converted form change
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
I wanted to change soul catcher because the point of unseen conversions is the classes are basically the same. The problem is that this is not the case for a few of them, such a priest and hunter.

Read full topic

item.title: Priest converted form change
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
Insanity:

Seriously, isn’t monk the name you have copied from one of your class suggestion .-.

I don’t like the other monk

item.title: Priest converted form change
item.dc:creator: Moleland
item.description:
There’s nothing wrong with soul catcher, as so long as you you’ve used your revive, it is hard to prove you aren’t priest

Read full topic

item.title: Priest converted form change
item.dc:creator: Strangle
item.description:
This is pretty balanced but to be honest their is something that makes it go over the limits aka whispers of the grave . Which basically makes you seem as priest and would be very hard to find like really hard to find . Reanimate again another ability which makes it very hard to find and of course bind soul i am fine with that. But overall i think Soulcatcher is better.

Read full topic

item.title: Priest converted form change
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
The thing I like about the unseen is each converted form is very similar to it’s previous class, with a few exceptions, one of those exceptions being priest.

Here is a way to keep the priest similar when converted:

The Monk
unseen support
Passive ability: Luck of the faithful
Immune to death once
Passive: Whispers of the grave
You can speak and listen to the dead at night as “priest”
Day ability: Bind soul
(1 use) your target will be immune to death tonight.
Night ability: Reanimate
(1 use) select an unseen player (possibly yourself), a class from a pop-up menu, and a dead player. If the target unseen member dies, they will appear to be the class you selected, and the dead player you selected will be revived. If they are a convert able class, they will become their unseen version.

Note: I do not know if this is balanced or not. I think it is?

Read full topic
